common-actions.title: Add
common-actions.desc: Adds an existing object to a list, container, or system (for example, adding a document to a folder).
common-actions.caption:
Combine Add with the object (for example, Add user, Add space, Add role, or Add privileges).
Contrast with Insert and New.

common-actions.title: Apply
common-actions.desc: Saves changes without closing the dialog. These properties often affect subsequent system behavior.
common-actions.caption: Use instead of Save Changes. Contrast with Save and Save As.

common-actions.title: Approve
common-actions.desc: Indicates the user agrees. In a business process, typically initiates the next step.
common-actions.caption: See Reject.

idioms.title: a la carte
idioms.desc: (adverb) pertaining to separately itemized objects.
idioms.caption: Context: Bluemix provides pay-as-you-go and subscription based pricing, a-la-carte and bundled services availability.

idioms.title: app
idioms.desc: (noun) a web or mobile device application.
idioms.caption:
Spell as shown, all lower case. In the doc, if for some reason it seems more appropriate to use application, use application for the first instance and then use app.
Context: It's easy to delete apps to free up some spaces in Bluemix at any time.

common-actions.title: Back
common-actions.desc: Returns the user to the previous step in a sequence of steps, such as in a wizard.
common-actions.caption: Use instead of Previous. See Next and Finish.

common-actions.title: Browse
common-actions.desc: Assists the user in entering a file name or file path (for example, on a button or link next to an entry field). Typically opens a secondary window where the user can locate and select the desired directory and file.

idioms.title: bestseller
idioms.desc: (noun) a significantly successful product or service in the marketplace.
idioms.caption: Context: Develop software for a cause or your companyâ€™s next bestseller.

idioms.title: bet
idioms.desc: (verb) to feel sure about something.
idioms.caption: Context: We bet you have built some sweet apps by now.

idioms.title: big savings
idioms.desc: (phrase) a significant amount of money saved.
idioms.caption: Context: You get big savings every month.

common-actions.title: Cancel
common-actions.desc: Stops the current action and closes the dialog.
common-actions.caption: Warn the user of any possible negative consequences of stopping an action from progressing, such as data corruption. See Reset.

common-actions.title: Clear
common-actions.desc: Clears all the fields or selections. Also deletes the contents of a document, such as a log. Typically the default selection or value is re-established for controls that always have a selection or value, such as radio buttons.
common-actions.caption: Where appropriate, combine Clear with the object (for example, Clear contents, Clear fields, Clear all). Contrast with Delete and Remove.

common-actions.title: Close
common-actions.desc: Closes the current page or window (for example, closing a secondary window containing online help).
common-actions.caption: Do not use Close together with OK or Cancel actions. Contrast with Done. See Cancel.

common-actions.title: Copy
common-actions.desc: Creates new instances of the selected objects to a specific destination.
common-actions.caption: Combine Copy with the object being copied (for example, Copy folder) or the destination (for example, Copy to clipboard) if there are multiple possibilities. Use instead of Create like. Contrast with New.

common-actions.title: Create
common-actions.desc: Label for a button in a dialog or form that creates a new object. The settings in the dialog are applied to the object when it is created.
common-actions.caption: Use New to initiate the action of creating a new object. Use Create to confirm the action after any naming or configuration. Contrast with Add, Copy, and Insert.

common-actions.title: Customize
common-actions.desc: Allow a user to make desired changes.

idioms.title: cold-blooded cyborg
idioms.desc: (noun) a man-like robot with no feelings (to cloud its judgment) that flawlessly executes its mandate.
idioms.caption: Context: Create apps with the efficiency of a cold-blooded cyborg.

idioms.title: congrats
idioms.desc: (noun) congratulations.
idioms.caption: Context: Congrats on creating your new app!

idioms.title: crash
idioms.desc: (noun) the unexpected termination of a software function.
idioms.caption: Context: Add the Mobile Quality Assurance service to your iOS app to view high value quality metrics, including information for crashes, bugs, user feedback, and user sentiment

idioms.title: crash
idioms.desc: (verb) of software, to unexpectedly terminate.
idioms.caption: Context: If a service crashes, the app might stop too.

common-actions.title: Delete
common-actions.desc: Destroys an existing object.
common-actions.caption: Combine Delete with the object to delete (for example, Delete column or Delete table). Contrast with Clear and Remove.

common-actions.title: Docs
common-actions.desc: Opens a separate window containing the landing page for Bluemix Docs.
common-actions.caption: Use only as link text from the console menu bar. See Learn More.

common-actions.title: Done
common-actions.desc: Indicates that the user has finished working in an environment (for example, editing templates) and wants to return to where he or she came from.
common-actions.caption: See Finish. Contrast with Close.

common-actions.title: Download
common-actions.desc: Transfers a file from a remote system to a local system.
common-actions.caption: See Upload.

common-actions.title: Drop
common-actions.desc: Use only for dropping a database table.
common-actions.caption: In other cases, use Delete, Clear, or Remove.

idioms.title: dev-to-dev
idioms.desc: (phrase) developer to developer.
idioms.caption: Context: Free support is available in our dev-to-dev forum.

idioms.title: Docs
idioms.desc: (noun) documentation.
idioms.caption: Context: View docs.

idioms.title: dream
idioms.desc: (adjective) pertaining to something that is exceptionally gratifying, excellent, or beautiful.
idioms.caption: Context: Build your dream app.

common-actions.title: Edit
common-actions.desc: Allows data or values to be changed.
common-actions.caption: Use instead of Modify unless you are modifying a table.

common-actions.title: Empty trash
common-actions.desc: Permanently deletes all files or objects that have been placed into a trash container.
common-actions.caption: See Move to trash.

common-actions.title: Export...
common-actions.desc: Saves data in a different format external to the system. Typically opens a secondary window for the user to specify the file type and destination (for example, storing table data as a set of comma-separated values).
common-actions.caption: See Import.

common-actions.title: Filter
common-actions.desc: Shortens a list to objects that match the filter criteria.
common-actions.caption: Contrast with Find and Search.

common-actions.title: Find
common-actions.desc: Moves the cursor to the next element matching the specified criteria (for example, view the next occurrence of a specific word within an email message).
common-actions.caption: Contrast with Filter and Search.

common-actions.title: Finish
common-actions.desc: Indicates completion of a series of steps, such as in a wizard.
common-actions.caption: See Done.

idioms.title: freebie
idioms.desc: (noun) something given away at no cost.
idioms.caption: Context: Enjoy freebies after the trial ends, and pay only for what you use beyond those.

common-actions.title: Get Help
common-actions.desc: Opens a search field from which the user can search for help information.
common-actions.caption: Use only as link text on Support widget from the console menu bar. See Docs and Learn more.

idioms.title: get in touch
idioms.desc: (verb) to contact someone.
idioms.caption: Context: The page also provides options to post your question to Stack Overflow, or to open a ticket by clicking Get in touch.

common-actions.title: Hide
common-actions.desc: Removes an element that was previously shown (for example, Hide descriptions).
common-actions.caption: See Show.

idioms.title: hackathon
idioms.desc: (noun) an event that brings together developers to work intensively on a software project.
idioms.caption: Context: Run a hackathon.

idioms.title: have a hand in
idioms.desc: (phrase) to be directly involved in the accomplishment or creation of something.
idioms.caption: Context: If you're a developer, you now have a hand in creating the future.

idioms.title: hit the ground running
idioms.desc: (phrase) to immediately accomplish something when just starting to learn how to do it.
idioms.caption: Context: Whatever your task, Bluemix contains everything you need to hit the ground running.

common-actions.title: Import...
common-actions.desc: Transforms data or objects from an external source. Typically opens a secondary window for the user to locate the external source (for example, creating a new table based on comma-separated values contained in a separate file).
common-actions.caption: See Export.

common-actions.title: Insert
common-actions.desc: Adds an element at a particular position in an ordered view (for example, adding a picture to the body of a document or inserting a record into a table).
common-actions.caption: Contrast with Add and New.

idioms.title: in a flash
idioms.desc: (phrase) quickly, immediately.
idioms.caption: Context: Deploy and test your app in a flash.

common-actions.title: Learn more
common-actions.desc: Opens additional, highly contextual information. Insert at the end of inline text or hover text where more information follows but does not fit in the current context.
common-actions.caption: If space permits, combine Learn more with meaningful text that describes the content you're pointing to. For example, if your user needs some best practices to manage apps in multiple regions, you could use Learn more about regions.

common-actions.title: Log in
common-actions.desc: Enters a site or application. This choice typically opens a form for entry of credentials. Also used on the submission button after users enter their credentials.
common-actions.caption: Use instead of Sign in. See Log out.

common-actions.title: Log out
common-actions.desc: Exits an application or site.
common-actions.caption: Use instead of Sign out. See Log in.

idioms.title: lost in space
idioms.desc: (phrase) to be hopelessly adrift with no chance of return, unlocatable, lost to the world.
idioms.caption: Context: This page seems to be lost in space.

common-actions.title: Move
common-actions.desc: Transfers an object from one container (for example, folder, activity, or page) to another.

common-actions.title: Move to trash
common-actions.desc: A soft delete. Moves a file or object to an area from where it can later be permanently deleted or recovered.
common-actions.caption: Use instead of Delete or Recycle bin. See Empty trash.

idioms.title: meetup
idioms.desc: (noun) an informal gathering.
idioms.caption: Context: Plan anything, even the monthly meetup.

idioms.title: muscle
idioms.desc: (noun) the metaphorical strength or physical power of something.
idioms.caption: Context: Whether startup or enterprise, your apps are supported by the muscle of an enterprise-ready cloud.

common-actions.title: New
common-actions.desc: Starts the creation of a new object. New either creates the object immediately or opens a dialog or set of fields where the user can enter properties.
common-actions.caption: Combine New with the object to create (for example, New user or New column). See Create. Contrast with Add, Copy, and Insert.

common-actions.title: Next
common-actions.desc: Advances the user to the next step in a sequence of steps, such as in a wizard.
common-actions.caption: See Back and Finish.

idioms.title: N/A
idioms.desc: (adjective) not applicable, not available.
idioms.caption: Spell as shown, all upper case.

common-actions.title: OK
common-actions.desc: Completes the current task.
common-actions.caption: The best practice is to use a label corresponding to the requested action, such as Save or Create. Use OK only when such a label isn't available.

idioms.title: oh no!
idioms.desc: (phrase) used to indicate shock.
idioms.caption: Context: Oh no! The free trial expired.

idioms.title: on prem, on-prem
idioms.desc: (adjective) on premises, on-premises.
idioms.caption: Context: Incrementally port application features across on-prem platforms and clouds with consistent services.

idioms.title: oops
idioms.desc: (expression) used to indicate an accident or a mistake.
idioms.caption: Context: Oops, sorry, the HTML5 File APIs are not fully supported in this browser.

idioms.title: ops
idioms.desc: (noun) operations.
idioms.caption: Context: Bluemix mobile cloud services help developers minimize ops and maintenance cost.

idioms.title: org
idioms.desc: (noun) organization.
idioms.caption: Context: Change to a different org.

common-actions.title: Play
common-actions.desc: Starts audio, video, or an animation.

common-actions.title: Post
common-actions.desc: Adds a new comment to an online community or adds status to a log or record.
common-actions.caption: If you're editing an existing comment, use Save instead.

common-actions.title: Preview
common-actions.desc: Shows how an object or content will appear with formatting applied before the content is published or distributed. Alternatively, provides an incomplete display of an existing object without leaving the current context.

common-actions.title: Print
common-actions.desc: Sends a copy of the currently selected object or the object in view to the printer.

common-actions.title: Redo
common-actions.desc: Redoes an undo action.
common-actions.caption: Likely used only as a tooltip on an icon button. See Undo.

common-actions.title: Refresh
common-actions.desc: Reloads the view of an object when the displayed view has become unsynchronized with the source.
common-actions.caption: Likely used only as a tooltip on an icon button.

common-actions.title: Reject
common-actions.desc: Indicates the user does not approve. In a business process, typically blocks the process from proceeding to the next step.
common-actions.caption: See Approve

common-actions.title: Reply
common-actions.desc: Indicates or completes a response to an email or a comment.

common-actions.title: Remove
common-actions.desc: Removes an object from a list or container but the object is not destroyed as a result of the action. Often requires one or more objects to be selected.
common-actions.caption: Where appropriate, combine Remove with the object that will be removed (for example, Remove user, Remove role, Remove privileges). Contrast with Delete and Clear.

common-actions.title: Reset
common-actions.desc: Reverts values back to their last saved state. The last saved state includes the values stored the last time the user clicked Apply. Does not close the dialog or window.
common-actions.caption: See Restore defaults, Undo, and Cancel. Contrast with Restore.

common-actions.title: Restore
common-actions.desc: Brings a file back after deletion, corruption, or similar event.
common-actions.caption: Contrast with Reset.

common-actions.title: Restore all
common-actions.desc: Completes a restore operation on all files or objects in a given system or container.
common-actions.caption: Contrast with Restore.

common-actions.title: Restore defaults
common-actions.desc: Sets form values to the default settings.
common-actions.caption: See Reset and Undo.

common-actions.title: Run
common-actions.desc: Runs a task, job, activity, or program.
common-actions.caption: Use instead of Execute.

idioms.title: ready for takeoff
idioms.desc: (phrase) prepared for use.
idioms.caption: Context: Your app is ready for takeoff!

common-actions.title: Save
common-actions.desc: Saves pending modifications made to a file or document. Does not close the window or panel.
common-actions.caption: Contrast with Apply.

common-actions.title: Save As...
common-actions.desc: Creates a new object based on the state of the object currently being viewed. The user names the new object and typically identifies its location.

common-actions.title: Search
common-actions.desc: Returns all objects (for example, files, names, or documents) within a defined set (for example, in a folder, directory, database, or the internet) that match some specified criteria.
common-actions.caption: Contrast with Find and Filter.

common-actions.title: Select
common-actions.desc: Selects data from a table.

common-actions.title: Select all
common-actions.desc: Adds all objects in the view to the selection set or checks all check boxes.
common-actions.caption: Contrast with Clear.

common-actions.title: Send
common-actions.desc: Transfers an email or other information to the recipient.

common-actions.title: Show
common-actions.desc: Reveals an object that was previously hidden (for example, Show descriptions).
common-actions.caption: See Hide.

common-actions.title: Sign up
common-actions.desc: Creates a user account or registers a user in a system.
common-actions.caption: Use instead of Register.

common-actions.title: Sort
common-actions.desc: Sorts a list or table column.
common-actions.caption: Likely used only as a tooltip on an icon button. Can be used without 'Ascending' or 'Descending' only if the order can be provided to a screen reader in the code for accessibility.

common-actions.title: Submit an idea
common-actions.desc: Opens a separate window containing the IBM Cloud Ideas portal.
common-actions.caption: Use only as link text on Support widget from the console menu bar.

idioms.title: skunkworks
idioms.desc: (noun) a high priority, often secret, project taken on by a small team without constraints from management.
idioms.caption: Context: Start a skunkworks.

idioms.title: startup
idioms.desc: (noun) a newly established business.
idioms.caption: Context: Whether startup or enterprise, your apps are supported by the muscle of an enterprise-ready cloud.

idioms.title: start from scratch
idioms.desc: (phrase) to start from the beginning, to start from nothing.
idioms.caption: Context: Choose a package of sample code and services, or start from scratch.

idioms.title: sweet
idioms.desc: (adjective) pertaining to something that is considered excellent, awesome, or cool.
idioms.caption: Context: We bet you've built some sweet apps by now.

idioms.title: sync
idioms.desc: (noun) synchronize.
idioms.caption:
Spell as shown (not synch).
Context: Download this .zip file template application or sync with the template source repository by copying and pasting the Git URL to a command line.

common-actions.title: Top
common-actions.desc: Returns to the top of the page.
common-actions.caption: Use instead of Back to top.

idioms.title: test drive
idioms.desc: (noun) a test or evaluation of a piece of software for a specified amount of time.
idioms.caption: Context: You have 1 day left in your Bluemix test drive.

idioms.title: time flies
idioms.desc: (phrase) time passes quickly.
idioms.caption: Context: Wow, time flies!

common-actions.title: Undo
common-actions.desc: Reverts to the state before the most recent change made by the user. Repeated use successively reverts to prior states in reverse chronological order. Applies to changes in data and not to changes made to the view.
common-actions.caption: Not all actions, such as Save, can be undone. See Redo, Reset, and Restore defaults.

common-actions.title: Update
common-actions.desc: Label for a button in a dialog or form for editing an object. The settings in the dialog are applied to the object when it is updated.
common-actions.caption: See Edit.

common-actions.title: Upload
common-actions.desc: Transfers a file from a local system to a remote system.
common-actions.caption: See Download.

idioms.title: unfavorite
idioms.desc:
(verb) to change the status of an item that was previously marked as a favorite.
(adjective) an item that is not a favorite.
idioms.caption: Context: Unfavorite.

common-actions.title: View details
common-actions.desc: Presents additional information or properties for the object.

idioms.title: voila
idioms.desc: (expression) draws attention to something that has been accomplished or gained.
idioms.caption: Context: Runtime and container usage is charged based on two things: How much memory your runtime or container uses and the duration that memory is used. Multiply the two together, and voila! The GB-hour.

idioms.title: wow!
idioms.desc: (expression) used to show astonishment, delight, or admiration.
idioms.caption: Context: Wow, time flies!
